parties.raw_snippet: This Master Agreement is made as of the 26 day of January, 2007 (the "Effective Date"), by and between Oriental Financial Group Inc., a Puerto Rico financial holding company ("Customer"), and Metavante Corporation, a Wisconsin corporation ("Metavante").
parties.reasoning: The parties are clearly identified in the opening sentence of the agreement as the two entities entering into this contract.

contract_type.raw_snippet:
TECHNOLOGY OUTSOURCING AGREEMENT

Customer desires Metavante to provide to Customer the services and licenses as set forth in this Agreement and its amendments, and Metavante desires to provide such services and licenses to Customer, all as provided in this Agreement and its amendments.

Metavante shall provide to Customer and Customer shall receive from Metavante, all upon the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement and Amendments, the Services and licenses specified.
contract_type.reasoning: While titled 'Technology Outsourcing Agreement', the core substance involves Metavante providing extensive technology services including data processing, software hosting, payment processing, ACH services, card services, and related technology services to Oriental Financial Group. The primary obligation is service provision by Metavante in exchange for fees. This is fundamentally an outsourcing arrangement where Customer transfers its technology operations to Metavante.

notice_period.raw_snippet: Unless Customer notifies Metavante of its intent not to renew this Agreement in writing within a period of three (3) months following the Renewal Notice, this Agreement shall automatically renew at the end of the Initial Term on the same terms (including pricing terms) for one (1) twelve-month period.
notice_period.reasoning: This clause specifies the notice period required to prevent automatic renewal. Customer must provide notice within 3 months after receiving Metavante's Renewal Notice (which is sent 12 months before expiration). This is the notice to terminate renewal, not a general termination notice.

expiration_date.raw_snippet: The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and end on November 30, 2014 (the "Initial Term").
expiration_date.reasoning: The agreement explicitly states a specific calendar date for the end of the Initial Term: November 30, 2014. This is not a relative term but an absolute date stated in the contract.

renewal_term.raw_snippet: Unless Customer notifies Metavante of its intent not to renew this Agreement in writing within a period of three (3) months following the Renewal Notice, this Agreement shall automatically renew at the end of the Initial Term on the same terms (including pricing terms) for one (1) twelve-month period.
renewal_term.reasoning: The contract provides for one automatic renewal period of 12 months at the end of the Initial Term, unless Customer provides notice not to renew. After this single 12-month extension, the agreement expires unless renewed in writing by the parties.
